config.question: Which of the following contributed to tensions among mine workers in the 1890s?

choices.content: the flood of workers from southern and eastern Europe
the arrival of “new” immigrants from England and Ireland
the inclusion of African Americans in the mine workers’ union

answer_3.response: Until 1890, English and Irish immigrants dominated the mine industry. After 1890, immigrants from southern and eastern Europe came to the mines to find work. As the depression deepened, tensions grew between miners and their employers and between the “old” miners and the “new.”
